title: Curved tabs. Copy the code to your chrome folder in css. For your own color you will have to change a couple of colors to siut. Mine is set up for light green.
content:
1. navigator-toolbox>toolbar:not(#toolbar-menubar):not(#TabsToolbar):not(#nav-bar) { 
   padding: 0px 4px 4px !important;  } 
  .tabbrowser-tab[fadein]:not([pinned]):not([style*="max-width"]){    max-width: 300px !important;

}

  1. tabbrowser-tabs { 
 --tab-min-height: 36px !important;  height: 36px !important;

} 

#tabs-newtab-button {    margin-left: 13px !important;    margin-bottom: -1px !important;  } .tabbrowser-tab {    margin: 0 -14px 0 -3px !important;  }    .tab-background{    margin: 0 10px !important;    background: #F0F2EA;    background-clip: border-box;    border: none !important;     -moz-transform: perspective(80px) rotateX(8deg) !important;   -webkit-transform: perspective(80px) rotateX(8deg) !important;    outline: none !important;    border-top: 1px solid #7E7B7B !important;    border-right: 1px solid #7E7B7B !important;    border-left: 1px solid #7E7B7B !important;    border-radius: 9px 9px 0 0 !important;   margin-bottom:-1px !important;

} 


  .tabbrowser-tab:hover > .tab-stack > .tab-background:not([selected="true"]) {    background-color: #D1D5C6 !important;  }    .tabbrowser-tab[selected="true"] .tab-background {    background: #F0F2EA !important;  }    .tabbrowser-tab[selected="true"] .tab-text.tab-label {    color: black !important;  }    .tab-line {    display: none !important;  }    .tab-content {    padding: 0 25px !important;  }     /* for backward compatibility */  .tabs-newtab-button.toolbarbutton-1 {    margin-left: -0px !important;  }    .titlebar-placeholder[type="pre-tabs"] {    border-inline-end: initial !important;  }    #tabbrowser-tabs:not([movingtab])>.tabbrowser-tab[beforeselected-visible]::after,  #tabbrowser-tabs[movingtab]>.tabbrowser-tab[visuallyselected]::before,  .tabbrowser-tab[visuallyselected]::after {    border-color: var(--tabs-border-color);    margin-top: 0 !important;    margin-bottom: 1px !important;    opacity: 8 !important;    border: none !important;  }    [tabsintitlebar]:root:not([extradragspace]) .tabbrowser-tab::after,  .tabbrowser-tab:hover::after,  #tabbrowser-tabs:not([movingtab])>.tabbrowser-tab[beforehovered]::after {    border: none !important;  }    .tab-text.tab-label {    text-shadow: initial !important;    color: black !important;    font-style: unset;    text-decoration: none !important;    -webkit-font-smoothing: antialiased !important;    -moz-osx-font-smoothing: grayscale !important;  }    .tabbrowser-tab:hover .tab-text.tab-label {    color: black !important;    text-shadow: none !important;    -moz-osx-font-smoothing: unset !important;  }
creator: neih19l57

title: MOZILLA_PKIX_ERROR_OCSP_RESPONSE_FOR_CERT_MISSING
content:
Hi there,

Our website is not showing to our customers and they are receiveing this error MOZILLA_PKIX_ERROR_OCSP_RESPONSE_FOR_CERT_MISSING

We have checked our site with SSL Labs https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html?d=locomotivestation.com.au and it returns showing the SSL is fine.

We can see the site and operate on Google Chrome but cannot work out why it is not displaying on Firefox.

Any suggestions?

Thanks
creator: smmhenry

title: Im copy image from paint.net to Google docs and image broke.
content:
Firefox 132.0.2 (64-bit)

In other browsers/programm work correctly https://docs.google.com/

From me topic: https://forums.getpaint.net/topic/130993-copy-paste-image/ Im copy image from paint.net to Google docs and image broke.

Image 1 Copy part/full image from Paint.net Ctrl+C https://i.imgur.com/bIQTdr0.png 2-3 Image after paste Ctrl+V in Google docs and this broke https://i.imgur.com/5J8lx7j.png https://i.imgur.com/HRqXvHT.png 4 Copy image from paint.net to Discord good work https://i.imgur.com/osHLsGa.png 5 Copy-paste from discord to Google docs also broke transparent. https://i.imgur.com/nSNdfk7.png

6 Im copy white square from Paint.net Ctrl+C https://i.imgur.com/BbCA2Tq.png 7 After paste Ctrl+V in Google doc, black line appeared. Broke image https://i.imgur.com/gR0sEzq.png

Not only me https://bugzilla.mozilla.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1866655 https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/questions/1436969 https://github.com/graphics32/graphics32/issues/257 https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Confluence-questions/Screenshots-are-corrupted-when-pasting-from-paint-net-into/qaq-p/2581186#M290501 https://forums.getpaint.net/topic/124628-1-px-line-on-top-of-every-image-pasted-into-firefox-from-paintnet/ - 2 page ideas how fix https://forums.getpaint.net/topic/124444-screenshots-are-corruptedshifted-when-pasting-from-paintnet-into-firefox
creator: hokagegaara

title: updating mozilla
content: My administrator is not available. How can I update mozilla ?
creator: hugonchristophe

title: Firefox memory leak and crash on linux
content: Hi, Firefox been really bad on Linux the past few months, it suffers from a severe memory leak in this following situation: - Multiple tabs, especially if they are in the private mode - The browser and these tabs are kept opened for few days - On linux I tried all the latest updates, I tried different types of firefox (waterfox ESR ZEN etc.), I disabled all addons, I tried all types of linux (debian, rpm, opensuse, and others), the problem is the same, it will have a big memory leak (32 gb ram) that it eats up all the ram, if I want to save an image it takes few minutes to save one, and recently it just crashes. This problem happens only on Linux, I have firefox account and it syncs the addons on my other windows machine, I have far more tabs opened and I have them opened now for weeks, and it's working as expected and smoothly with no issues, so it must be with the linux package.
creator: firefox2742

title: Google 3rd party sign in feature.
content: As is known, Google likes to offer to sign in users on 3rd party sites. I have no interest in using Google to sign in to websites. How does it even know I'm there? It's following me around the web. I've tried in vain to find a way to turn this feature off. Does anybody know how to do it?

title: High GPU usage when watching Videos. (Youtube)
content: Recently found a problem of high GPU usage when watching videos. I have encounter this on other websites but YouTube is the most prevalent. Currently running is a NVIDIA 4060ti and the percentages I am getting range from a low of 15 to the high of 28. Hoping to gather some information on the topic and would love some explanation. I have already tried with no extensions enabled but had no luck in stopping the issue. Version 132.0.2 (64-bit) on a Windows 10 desktop.
creator: aidan.lortscher

title: Soundcloud non va su firefox
content:
Buongiorno, sono ritornato ad usare firefox dopo un paio di anni ora sto riscontrando un problema su sound cloud quando apro il sito mi visualizza

Sorry! Something went wrong Is your network connection unstable or browser outdated?

il fatto è che non mi va solo su firefox quindi non posso chiedere supporto neanche a soundcloud perchè fino a ieri su un altro browser andava tutto bene ho provato ha cancellare cache non so ditemi voi come risolvere questo problema
